comments:
When parsing an XSD schema which was fine in Eclipse 1.0.2, I get an exception.

I very recently upgraded to 1.10  - I am running outside of eclipse IDE, so I 
took the new EMF and XSD jar files (common.jar,xsd.jar, ecore.jar,and 
xsd.resource.jar). I did not take a new copy of Xerces. the only other eclipse 
jars I have are resources.jar and runtime.jar - these are from 2.0.1.

The exception gnerated seems to be caught internally, and all seems ok, but if 
after that, I parse a schema that has some includes, then the validate of that 
schema fails. The exception stack trace is also pasted at end of message. 

The schema was :

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<xsd:schema xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2000/10/XMLSchema" 
xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3c.org/2000/10/XMLSchema-Instance" 
xmlns:o="orderTargetNs" targetNamespace="orderTargetNs" 
elementFormDefault="qualified" 
xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.w3c.org/2000/10/XMLSchema XMLSchema.xsd">
	<xsd:element name="shipment" type="o:Shipment"/>

	<xsd:complexType name="Shipment">
		<xsd:sequence>
			<xsd:element name="contact" type="o:Contact"/>
			<xsd:element name="shippingAddress" type="xsd:string"/>
			<xsd:element name="contents" type="o:Contents"/>
		</xsd:sequence>
		<xsd:attribute name="id" type="xsd:integer"/>
		<xsd:attribute name="total" type="xsd:decimal"/>
	</xsd:complexType>

	<xsd:complexType name="Contact">
		<xsd:sequence>
			<xsd:element name="fn" type="xsd:string"/>
			<xsd:element name="ln" type="xsd:string"/>
		</xsd:sequence>
	</xsd:complexType>

	<xsd:complexType name="Contents">
		<xsd:sequence>
			<xsd:element name="content" type="o:Content" 
minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/>
		</xsd:sequence>
	</xsd:complexType>

	<xsd:complexType name="Content">
		<xsd:sequence>
			<xsd:element name="name" type="xsd:string"/>
			<xsd:element name="quantity" type="xsd:integer"/>
			<xsd:element name="total" type="xsd:decimal"/>
		</xsd:sequence>
	</xsd:complexType>
</xsd:schema>

Test code in java

The actual scenario where the bug happens is different since we are using
Eclipse wrapped by our calls and doing other things inbetween.

I could not make the second exception happen using this code, but I am hoping
that the stack trace is enough to identify the problem.

BTW, the second schema parsing failure only happens if the first schema is 
parsed. Otherwise it works fine.

Created an attachment (id=5850)
Cached schemas 

Hayden,

The first schema is pretty bogus with its use of old schema for schema
namespaces.  In order to get this working, I think you'll need some changes to
the hacked up cached versions of these older namespace schemas.  I'll attach a
replacement for the xsd.resource.jar that you can try.	You'll need to copy the
cache subdirectory to the one in org.eclipse.xsd/cache if you want to try this
in Eclipse, but I think you are running standalone and need the jar.

Please try it out and let me know if this will solve your problem.  (It works
for me.)

I tried doing what you said - the attached xsd.resources.jar was problematic - 
something to do with the plugin references - so I extracted all of the cached 
folder and merged it into the xsd.resource.jar from XSD 1.10.

I got the following exception - seems to be a problem trying to resolve the 
path of the W3C schema - why is it trying to load it? Doesn't Eclipse know that 
it's a 'silly' reference?

Hayden,

Sorry, the fix relies on relative imports within a jar working correctly(the 
old-schema-namespace schema has to import an xml.xsd that uses the 
old-schema-namespace to define itself) so it will only work with 1.1.1.

Schemas using the older namespaces should really be converted to be useful and 
meaningful since the schema syntax has changed since then and only the current 
syntax is fully supported.

Thanks for trying it out...
This is fixed in the latest driver.
